page.title: 03MARSH FARM
page.content: This is the largest farm in the area. It is a modern dairy farm covering 260acres, all permanent grassland except 26acres of cider orchard. Land is classed as grade 2 agriculturally, it consists of heavy, wet clays needing extensive drainage. Stock - 160 Friesian cattle - 96 Friesian/Hereford store Labour - 3 stockmen Milking, twice daily, is in a 10 point herringbone parlour, each session taking 2hrs. Cattle are computer fed in the parlour being given a cake of soya, barley and molassess. Average yield is 1102 gallons per cow per annum. Grazing is on a 21 paddock system ensuring a fresh paddock daily. 66% of summer grass is conserved for winter feed. Cattle are loose housed in three yards in winter.
